fields.summary: Spine alerts are not visible on SCR

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
With the use of the spine alert service I am unable to view doctors access to SCR.  This functionality was tested successfully on 12th January in Live and was working for consultants at that time.  Since go-live on 30th March, we have been unable to see alerts for access by any doctors.
    
Emma Swift at HSCIC is fully aware of the issue and will be able to advise further if HSCIC helpdesk need further information.

Reported by name
    Elizabeth DHADWAR
<##eof##>

Reported by phone
    024 76378506
<##eof##>

Reported by email
    elizabeth.dhadwar@geh.nhs.uk
<##eof##>

Is reported by affected end user?
    No
<##eof##>

User's Name
    Julie Meer
<##eof##>

User's phone
    07919290995
<##eof##>

User's email
    julie.meer@geh.nhs.uk
<##eof##>

User's UUID (Smartcard ID)
    153745872017
<##eof##>

Hospital / Site
    [RLT01] George Eliot Hospital-Acute Services
<##eof##>

Steps to Recreate the Incident - How did I get here? 
    Doctors are using SCR but the alerts are not visible on the alert viewer
<##eof##>

Date/Time the incident occurred
    30/03/2015 08:00
<##eof##>

Date/Time it last worked 
    12/01/2015
<##eof##>

What steps have been taken so far to resolve the incident 
    access has been checked
<##eof##>

fields.summary: Receiving incorrect rejections messages from the spine for Re-claim Prescriptions

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
Raised By:
RX SYSTEMS
TANZILA AKRAM
tanzila.akram@rxsystems.co.uk
01923 474600

Message returned: ReimbursementSpineRejection: Claim amendment is not permitted outside of the claim period (Code: 0100

The prescription details are:
1.       Script ID: 0E2D1FCD-D135-8CB4-E050-950AE073510A
Short ID: 52FE5B-C81007-6FF29I
DN sent: 03/03/2015
Claim sent: 03/03/2015
Re-claim attempted: 01/04/2015

2.       Script ID: 0E2D1FCD-D110-8CB4-E050-950AE073510A
Short ID: 54D30E-C81007-6FF1FW
DN sent: 03/03/2015
Claim sent: 03/03/2015
Re-Claim: 03/03/2015
Re-Claim attempted: 02/04/2015


3.       Script ID:0E2D1FCD-D13A-8CB4-E050-950AE073510A
Short ID: 22DAAF-C81007-6FF2BI
DN sent: 03/03/2015
Claim sent: 03/03/2015
Re-Claim Attempted: 02/04/2015


The above three prescriptions are within the claim period however we are receiving reimbursement spine rejections for these scripts. Seems like the claims submitted within the first 5 days of the month from the previous month are being rejected. Please advise further.

Currently we have to wait a month to re-test the above scenarios as the spine relies on the real time, can you advise how we can test without waiting another month?

status.description: Resolution needs to be reviewed prior to issue close
status.name: Peer Review

fields.summary: CP-IS Acknowledgement Response Files Produced are Schema Invalid for Failed Records

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
A defect has been identified with the CP-IS Client whereby the CP-IS Local Authority Acknowledgement Response (REPC_MT000003GB01) files that are returned are not always schema valid. The problem occurs where the record has not been accepted by the CP-IS Client for any reason and an invalidCP-ISRecord is returned in the file. When an invalidCP-ISRecord is returned the record is missing the “pertinentInformation” element.

This issue has been identified whilst Integration Testing with the Local Authority System Suppliers in the Spine2 INT environment but this is an issue with the LIVE CP-IS Client.

fields.summary: Alert Messages are not being correctly handled and therefore are not available for Caldicott Gaurdians or Privacy Officers to review and monitor acces

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
1. Patient SCR record is requested for viewing by SCR SMS.
2. In the instances where a "self claim LR" is required or "emergency access" is invoked to obtain access to the SCR record, an alert message is created and sent to spine to record this.
3. The Caldicott Guardian or Privacy Officer for the organisation where the SCR belongs logs into the alert viewer and can see details of the alert created against the SCr. Note the CG/PO can only view alerts raised for SCR access in their own trust, in the case of our testing "5BU", This alert is currently NOT being created in either the DEVELOPMENT or INTEGRATION sandpits.

fields.summary: Surgery have prescribed for the patient and the prescription has gone to the spine but when trying to find it at the pharmacy and surgery area they were unable to locate it.

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
Surgery have prescribed for the patient and the prescription has gone to the spine but when trying to find it at the pharmacy and surgery area they were unable to locate it. A few days later it does display on the system but cannot be cancelled, message says script pending medication and pending cancellation, pending cancellation, medication not found.
    
    It looks as though the incident is isolated and would like to know what has happened to this patient as they cannot tell where this went wrong on the spine. 
    
    Prescription barcodes - 50D829-C82678-0DACF5 +
    43B8E9-C82678-0DACEC
    
    User did not have the NHS Number.
